page.title: 01Population in Cowdenbeath
page.content: The Cowdenbeath population rose steadily from 7000 in 1911 to its highest of 14215 in 1921 because of the demand for miners in the prosperous mining town. Improvements in mining machinery put jobs at { jeopardy and so people had to move out of the area to seek new employment elsewhere. The figures have slowly decreased to 13151 in 1951, to 11920 in 1961, and to 10664 in 1971. In 1981 however there was a slight rise to 12272 even though surprisingly the birth rate dropped from 7.3% to 5.6% in 1981. The uptrend in recent years could be accounted for by the building of small housing schemes and small industries arriving. The Cowdenbeath area still has high unemployment figures despite this, with a total of 6124 unemployed.
